summary: Silverfish, scientifically known as Lepisma saccharinum, are tiny, wingless insects with a silvery grey color, hence their name. They move in a fish-like manner and eat carbohydrates like sugar and starch. Although "silverfish" is used for many Zygentoma species, the Entomological Society of America uses it only for Lepisma saccharinum.
title: Silverfish
